Plot Known Markers Detected

Plot Known Markers Detected

plotKnownMarkersDetected(object, knownMarkersDetected, ...)

# S4 method for seurat,grouped_df
plotKnownMarkersDetected(object,
  knownMarkersDetected, tsneColor = scale_color_viridis(discrete = FALSE),
  violinFill = scale_fill_viridis(discrete = TRUE),
  dotColor = scale_color_gradient(low = "lightgray", high = "purple"),
  dark = TRUE, pointsAsNumbers = FALSE, headerLevel = 2L)

Arguments

object

Object.
knownMarkersDetected

grouped_df.
...

Additional arguments.
tsneColor

Color palette to use for tSNE plot.
violinFill

Color palette to use for violin plot.
dotColor

Color palette to use for dot plot.
dark

Plot against a dark background using midnightTheme().
pointsAsNumbers

Plot the points as numbers (TRUE) or dots (FALSE).
headerLevel

R Markdown header level.

Value

Show graphical output. Invisibly return ggplot plotlist.

See also

Other Clustering Functions: cellTypesPerCluster, knownMarkersDetected, plotCellTypesPerCluster, plotFeatureTSNE, plotMarkerTSNE, plotMarkers, plotPCA, plotPCElbow, plotTSNE, plotTopMarkers, sanitizeMarkers, topBarcodes, topMarkers

Examples

load(system.file(
    "extdata/known_markers_small.rda",
    package = "bcbioSingleCell"
))
load(system.file("extdata/seurat_small.rda", package = "bcbioSingleCell"))

# seurat ====
# Let's plot the first 2 markers, as a quick example
plotKnownMarkersDetected(
    object = seurat_small,
    knownMarkersDetected = known_markers_small[seq_len(2L), ]
)
#> 
   |                                                  | 0 % ~calculating  
#> 
#> ## Natural Killer Cell {.tabset}
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> ### NCAM1
#> 
#>
